title: Producing Women (2015).pdf Gooner
description:
Producing Women - The Internet, Traditional Femininity, Queerness and Creativity (2015).pdf Gooner

Publisher: Routledge (March 24, 2015)
Language: English
ISBN-10: 1138776785
ISBN-13: 978-1138776784

Producing Women examines the ways femininity is produced through new media. Michele White considers how women are constructed, produce themselves as subjects, form vital production cultures on sites like Etsy, and deploy technological processes to reshape their identities and digital characteristics. She studies the means through which women market traditional female roles, are viewed, and produce and restructure their gendered, raced, eroticized, and sexual identities. Incorporating a range of examples across numerous forms of mediaâ€•including trash the dress wedding photography, Internet how-to instructions about zombie walk brides, nail polish blogging, DIY crafting, and reborn doll productionâ€•Producing Women elucidates womenâ€™s production cultures online, and the ways that individuals can critically study and engage with these practices
